title: Genesis SFL Moves Up Launch Dates for Two Return Capsule Demo Missions
summary:
Croatian space logistics startup Genesis Space Flight Laboratories (Genesis SFL) has moved up the launch of two subscale demonstration missions from 2027 to 2026. Initially founded in Slovenia in 2020 as the Genoplant Research Institute, the company first focused on developing its Genoplant Analyzer, a “portable laboratory” for plant diagnostic monitoring. In July 2025, it […]
The post Genesis SFL Moves Up Launch Dates for Two Return Capsule Demo Missions appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA’s Webb Observes Immense Stellar Jet on Outskirts of Our Milky Way
summary: A blowtorch of seething gasses erupting from a volcanically growing monster star has been captured by NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope. Stretching across 8 light-years, the length of the stellar eruption is approximately twice the distance between our Sun and the next nearest stars, the Alpha Centauri system. The size and strength of this particular […]

title: Immense stellar jet in Milky Way outskirts

summary:
“The Space Force we have is not the Space Force we need” —Gen. B. Chance Saltzman, Chief of Space Operations The United States and our allies have never been more dependent on space-based capabilities. Every other military service depends on capabilities from space to do their jobs. A loss of space capability would have a […]

title: Japan’s IHI expands constellation plans with SatVu thermal imaging partnership
summary:
Japan’s IHI is broadening its push to build a sovereign Earth observation constellation, partnering with U.K.-based SatVu to explore adding thermal imaging satellites alongside radar and other sensors already in the works.
The post Japan’s IHI expands constellation plans with SatVu thermal imaging partnership appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: What Would It Take to Say We Found Life? We Asked a NASA Expert: Episode 63
summary: What Would It Take to Say We Found Life? We call this the podium test. What would it take for you personally to confidently stand up in front of an international audience and make that claim? When you put it in that way, I think for a lot of scientists, the bar is really high. […]

title: NASA to Share Details of New Perseverance Mars Rover Finding
summary: NASA will host a news conference at 11 a.m. EDT Wednesday, to discuss the analysis of a rock sampled by the agency’s Perseverance Mars rover last year, which is the subject of a forthcoming science paper. The agency previously announced this event as a teleconference.  Watch the news conference on NASA’s YouTube channel and the agency’s […]

title: Musk confident Starship will start launching 100 tons to orbit next year
summary:
SpaceX Chief Executive Elon Musk says he is confident that Starship can start delivering 100 tons of payload to orbit next year while reusing both stages.

title: Ramses asteroid mission on track ahead of key funding
summary:
A European-led mission to the asteroid Apophis is on schedule ahead of key funding decisions in the coming months in both Europe and Japan.
